Authorities' Attitude toward Constr. of U.S. Embassy Building Denounced
articles.content:
Authorities' Attitude toward Constr. of U.S. Embassy Building Denounced 
    Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Citizens' Meeting against the Construction of New U.S. Embassy Building and Apartment House at the Site of Toksu Palace comprising over 30 civic organizations reportedly called a press conference in front of the "government" building on Dec. 4 to voice opposition to authorities' attitude toward the construction of a new U.S. embassy building.
 The press conference took place after the south Korean "government" announced on Dec. 3 that it would affirmatively examine the construction of the new U.S. embassy building at the site of the Toksu Palace at a meeting of ministers concerned, considering the south Korea-U.S. alliance and national benefits of the two countries. 
 A press release was published at the conference.    
 Denouncing the authorities' attitude as an act of abandoning the preservation of cultural heritages, the release demanded the U.S. immediately stop unreasonable pressure upon the south Korean authorities with regard to the construction.

Resolution Signed
articles.content:
Resolution Signed 
    Beijing, December 5 (KCNA) -- A resolution of the 55th Meeting of the Board of the DPRK-China Hydro-electric Power Company was signed in Beijing on Dec. 5.
 Present at the signing ceremony were members of a DPRK delegation headed by Mun Chang Nam, first vice-minister of Electricity and Coal Industries who is also director of the Board of the company, and Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China, from the DPRK side and officials concerned including Director of the Board of the Company Zheng Baoshen, deputy general director of the Chinese State Electric Network Company, from the Chinese side.
